info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Schoharie, southeastern Herkimer and Montgomery Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Springfield, or 10 miles west of Canajoharie, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Canajoharie, Fonda, Fort Plain, Sharon Springs, Fort Johnson, Ames, Tribes Hill, Glen, Charleston, Fultonville, Palatine Bridge, Nelliston, Cook Corners, Church Corners, Rockwell Corners, Flat Creek, Market Corners, Ripple Corners, McKinley and Oak Ridge. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 28 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.
